short_summary: The Canadian Coast Guard requires services to maintain a Seasonal Aids to Navigation System on the Southern Lakes in Yukon Territory and British Columbia.
description: The Canadian Coast Guard requires services to maintain a Seasonal Aids to Navigation System on the Southern Lakes in Yukon Territory and British Columbia that includes thirty-seven (37) unlighted buoys and six (6) unlighted beacons. The buoys must be deployed in May right after the ice recedes and checked for correct position once a month until they are recovered and stored in October, shortly before freeze up. The beacons are left in place all year and are checked for correct operation once a month during the navigation season (typically May to October inclusive). In addition to these planned monthly checks; repairs and repositioning must be done as required.",
tags: Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement

# Tenders

## Solicitation Title (English, French)

* **Placing, Lifting/Removal, Maintaining and the Servicing of Navigation Aids on the Southern Lakes - Yukon Territory**
* **Mise en place, levage/enlèvement, surveillance et entretien des aides à la navigation dans les lacs du sud – Yukon**
